Key Match Events: Brandon Marsh hit a three-run homer in the sixth inning against Charlie Morton
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning to win the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies anticipated facing lefty Aaron Bummer in the Atlanta Braves bullpen and chose not to pinch-hit for Brandon Marsh
The Braves manager, Brian Snitker, chose to face Marsh against Morton
Post-Match Reflections: Marsh said the game was a huge win for the Phillies and they need to take as many games as they can against the Braves
Castellanos said the game was a big jumpstart for the Phillies and they need to keep going
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies went to bed with a six-game lead over the Braves
Marsh has struggled against lefties this season, but was successful against Morton
The Phillies have stressed the importance of an all-fields approach to hitting
Others: Alec Bohm hurt his left hand on a swing and may need a day or two to recover
The Phillies will see how Bohm feels on Friday
The Braves have reverse splits, but Marsh has struggled against lefties this season
